visualization_prompt: Create a Highcharts chartOptions object to render a polar chart with the following specifications: Chart type: Polar, Chart title: Monthly Temperature Variation, Axes and labels styling: Use a dark blue color (#003366) for the axis labels and titles, with a font size of 14px. The title should be bold and centered. Data series: The data series should include monthly temperature data for a year, with the name 'Temperature'. Custom colors: Use a gradient from light blue (#ADD8E6) to dark blue (#003366) for the series. Additional configurations: Set the chart background to a light gray (#F5F5F5), add a legend at the bottom of the chart, and set the chart margins to 50px on all sides.
visualization_explanation: The provided Highcharts chartOptions object is configured to render a polar chart with a specific set of styles and data. The chart type is set to 'polar', which creates a circular chart suitable for displaying cyclic data like monthly temperatures. The chart title is 'Monthly Temperature Variation', styled with a dark blue color, bold font, and centered alignment. The x-axis represents the months of the year, with labels styled in dark blue and a font size of 14px. The y-axis is labeled 'Temperature (°C)' with the same styling. The data series, named 'Temperature', includes monthly temperature data for a year, with a custom color gradient from light blue to dark blue. The chart background is set to a light gray, and the legend is positioned at the bottom center of the chart. The chart margins are set to 50px on all sides to provide adequate spacing around the chart.
